questions.question: Acute cholecystitis is defined as sudden inflammation of the gallbladder wall.
questions.explanation: TRUE. Acute cholecystitis is simply defined as 'the sudden, acute inflammation of the wall of the gallbladder'.

questions.question: Acalculous cholecystitis is the most common form of this condition.
questions.explanation: FAKE. The vast majority of cases of acute cholecystitis (between 90% and 95%) are of lithiasis origin, that is, caused by gallstones. The alithiatic form is a minority.

questions.question: Acute cholecystitis is more prevalent in men than in women.
questions.explanation: FAKE. Acute cholecystitis is more prevalent in women than in men, with a ratio of 3 to 2.

questions.question: Biliary colic is a constant and persistent pain, similar to that of acute cholecystitis.
questions.explanation: FAKE. Biliary colic is an intermittent spasm, unlike the pain of acute cholecystitis, which is constant and persistent due to an obstruction that does not give way.

questions.question: Murphy's sign is a pathognomonic finding of acute cholecystitis.
questions.explanation: TRUE. Murphy's sign is described as a pathognomonic sign. It consists of acute pain and cessation of deep inspiration when pressure is exerted on the right upper quadrant of the abdomen.

questions.question: The diagnosis of acute cholecystitis should be based solely on clinical findings.
questions.explanation: FAKE. Accurate diagnosis should not be based on clinical symptoms alone, but a joint evaluation of clinical symptoms, laboratory studies, and imaging findings is essential.

questions.question: Most cases of cholecystitis are caused by gallstone impaction.
questions.explanation: TRUE. The pathophysiology explains that the most frequent initial event (more than 90% of cases) is the impaction of a stone in the cystic duct, which triggers inflammation.

questions.question: Increased internal pressure in the gallbladder can cause ischemia of its wall.
questions.explanation: TRUE. The increased internal pressure compresses the blood vessels supplying the gallbladder wall, which can lead to tissue ischemia and necrosis.

questions.question: Bacterial infection of the gallbladder is always the initial event of acute cholecystitis.
questions.explanation: FAKE. The initial process is chemical due to the stagnation of bile. Bacterial infection is a secondary complication facilitated by stasis and ischemia.

questions.question: Gangrenous cholecystitis is the least common complication of acute cholecystitis.
questions.explanation: FAKE. Gangrenous cholecystitis is mentioned as the most common complication, occurring in approximately 20% of cases.
